cards.markdown:
[![](https://i0.wp.com/photos22.flickr.com/25227347_197273ec07.jpg?w=960)](http://www.flickr.com/photos/adders/25227347/ "photo sharing") [They Died For Us](http://www.flickr.com/photos/adders/25227347/), originally uploaded by [Adam Tinworth](http://www.flickr.com/people/adders/).
Perhaps the biggest sign of London’s defiance in the wake of the bombing was the crowd of [hundreds of thousands of people](http://www.guardian.co.uk/secondworldwar/story/0,14058,1525733,00.html) who thronged the streets of London to commemorate the fact that 60 years had passed since the end of World War II. Just days after the bomb, fear of terrorism didn’t keep them away.
